intro: Hexatheca fulva, commonly known as the velvetleaf hexatheca, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Hexatheca fulva is often found in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats.
